required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CLaret Embolic Protection ANd TAVI - Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, randomized study was designed to investigate the benefit of using a Filter-Protection-Device (Claret MontageTM Dual Filter System) during transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) with a Medtronic CoreValve®.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

primary_outcome.measure: Rate and Size of Cerebral Embolism
primary_outcome.description: Primary endpoint ist the rate and the size of cerebral embolism in postinterventional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).

clinical_study.condition: Frequency of Cerebral Perfusion Defects After TAVI
Size of Cerebral Perfusion Defects After TAVI

arm_group.description: Patient is treated with Cerebral protection Filter.
Patient is not treated with Cerebral protection Filter.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must be scheduled to undergo an endovascular aortic valve prosthesis (Medtronic CoreValve®) implant procedure with the femoral artery as the intended access site for the valve delivery system.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is unsuitable for TAVI
- Prior Stroke or TIA in the last 12 month
- Carotic stenosis >70%
- Relevant stenosis of the brachiocephalic trunc or the right subclavian artery
- Expected Non-compliance for follow-ups
- Pregnancy
- Patient is already recruited for another study
